page.title: 08Supernatural Newton/Dunham
page.content: Newton can claim many haunted houses. Perhaps the most notorious is the White Hart Inn where Buck Forrester, one time landlord of the pub, who died in 1940 is said to appear on the upstairs landing. His last visitation was to a local lady who works at the Inn. He is said to be guarding his hoard of money. Another such haunted house is Old Hall Farm, a listed building, where children sleeping in an upstairs room have seen an old man and footsteps have sometimes been heard when no one was apparently upstairs. Hall Farm, North Clifton is reputed to be the haunting ground of a woman. Also at North Clifton a ghostly dog has been seen crossing the road near a disused railway station.The more down to earth in the area tend to discount the stories.
